algorithm_technique: Iterate through numbers, reverse them, and add to a set for distinct count.
Iterate through numbers, convert to string, reverse, convert back, add to set.
problem_summary_simple: Count distinct integers after adding the reverse of each number in the input array.
problem_summary_technical: Utilizes a hash set to store unique integers, including original and reversed versions of each number.
key_insights: A set is the ideal data structure to automatically handle distinctness.
Reversing digits can be done arithmetically or by string manipulation.
Leading zeros after reversal (e.g., 10 -> 01) are handled correctly by integer conversion.
